Key Match Events: England conceded the first goal at the national stadium — yet again
Alexander-Arnold nearly scores from nothing, firing a shot from the wing that takes a slight deflection and nearly finds the inside of the far post
Pre-Game Insights: Southgate: It's not going to be as easy as people say
Southgate: We've got to be far better without the ball than we were today, and then we've got to show more composure than we’ve shown with the ball
Post-Match Reflections: Southgate: We learned a lot. We know the performance wasn’t good enough. Equally, I think we needed the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is the first time since 1968 that England have lost their final match before a major international tournament.
England outshot Iceland 13 to eight tonight, but Iceland recorded four shots on goal to just one for the hosts.
Others: England can’t have too many complaints tonight. Defensively they have been caught out far too often and while they have had a couple of great chances they should have taken in each half, they haven’t created enough opportunities.
